intro: Tanacetum glanduliferum, commonly known as the meadow tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, button-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, aromatic leaves that emit a strong, often disagreeable odor. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Tanacetum glanduliferum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
